noun.description: A shoot or twig inserted into a slit on the trunk or stem of a living plant, from which it receives sap.
A piece of living tissue that is transplanted surgically.

verb.description: Insert (a shoot or twig) as a graft.
examples: it was common to graft different varieties onto a single tree trunk
they can graft a new hand onto the arm

verb.description: Insert or fix (something) permanently to something else, typically in a way considered inappropriate.
examples: western-style government could not easily be grafted onto a profoundly different country

origin: Mid 19th century: perhaps related to the phrase spade's graft the amount of earth that one stroke of a spade will move, based on Old Norse grǫftr digging.
